ygData.subject: Re: Been there done that, Flameless Lantern
ygData.msgSnippet: Nope gnomes have a 50% in Tinkering automatically but won t improve till 16th.  As for the Infer Goggles Yes that has been confirmed by GM but NO clue how to
ygData.messageBody:
Nope gnomes have a 50% in Tinkering automatically but won't improve till
16th. As for the Infer Goggles Yes that has been confirmed by GM but NO
clue how to make. I have found only 2 books on tinkering so far.

<-- Enigma -->
http://members.door.net/enigma



-----Original Message-----
From: Rick Jones [SMTP:rjones@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 4:45 AM
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Been there done that, Flameless Lantern

From: "Rick Jones" <rjones@...>

I believe you can't Tinker at all until level 16. Books are cheap, 2gp or
something
Toolbox? can't remember 2-5pp or something.

Infravision goggles? Well, I don't know that any of us have found the book
to
make those yet. It's not in either book I have.

-Zikkin

mstokes wrote:

> From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
> WOOHOO,
>
> I'm Really excited to here some people are successfully tinkering. I've
just
> reached level 9 myself, and finished buying all the 3rd circle spells
that I
> need. Tinkering is now my next goal. I have a few questions though. At
what
> level will your tinkering skills improve. I haven't been back to my
homeland
> in a while and I was wondering how much the toolkit and the first book
cost.
>
> Malkin
> Gnomish Wizard and soon to be seller of infravision goggles.
>
> David Nelson wrote:
>
> > From: David Nelson <DNelson@...>
> >
> > Same here.. made the Flameless Lantern last night myself. Glad to
finally
> > see something happen with tinkering!
> >
> > -Emerical
> > Solusek Ro
> >
> >
> > From: rjones@...
> >
> > Ok, so after the solution for Firewater was given
> > to me, I tried Tinkering the stuff, simple. Worked
> > every time. Then I tried the only item that I could afford and tada,
the
> > first(in the game I think) Flameless Lantern (gave it away) then two
> > failures. But all in all I made 3. They seem to be
> > at least as bright as Lightstone, possibly brighter, but being a Gnome,
what
> > do I need it for? :) But it's been done. Tinkering works.
> > Going to put in my order for Pie Tins and start
> > making Compasses. And as soon as I find a tattered
> > cloak, it's Thermal Cloak time. Man I need more money.
> >
> > -Zikkin
> >
